Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance as to Jerry Rivera-Torres(3), Justo L. Burgos-Figueroa(6), Jose De la Rosa- Rodriguez(7), Miguel A. Rivera-Mercado(8), Jose H. Santiago-Torres(9), Antonio Borrero-Vargas(13), Efren Colon-Cruz(32) held on 10/30/2012. Present were AUSA Olga Castellon, AUSA Teresa Zapata. Defendants were provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 forms filled by defendants, the Court ordered that CJA Panel members be appointed to represent them and defendant #1-Carlos Perez-Casiano shall retain counsel. Defendants are ordered temporarily detained pending hearings Arraignment/Detention set for 11/2/2012 at 2:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (USPTO present) (amr) (Entered: 10/31/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance/Detention Hearings as to Maria Conde-Rodriguez(11) held on 10/30/2012. Present were AUSA Olga Castellon and AUSA Teresa Zapata. Defendant was provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and her rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 forms filled by defendant, the Court ordered that CJA Panel member be appointed to represent her. As to Detention, the Court imposed bail in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured, including Drug testing; employment or education; plus all other standard conditions of release apply. Government had no objection to bail. Arraignment set for 11/14/2012 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (USPTO present) (amr) (Entered: 11/02/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Teresa Zapata and Olga Castellon, for deft., Esther Castro and PO Emanuel Bravo. Arraignment/Detention as to Jerry Rivera-Torres (3) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 11/2/2012. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel had no evidence to rebut the presumption, but reserved the right to reopen the hearing. The Court ordered defendant detained on the basis of risk of flight and danger to the community. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 02:56.Hearing ended at 03:01.Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (ft) (Entered: 11/13/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Victor Acevedo, for deft., Hector Deliz and PO Maria Goytia. Arraignment/Detention as to Antonio Borrero- Vargas (13) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 11/5/2012. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The government had no objection that defendant be released, but requested that drug treatment program be one of the bail conditions. The Court imposed bail in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured, out patient substance abuse treatment program, EMD with Home Detention, substance treatment program, defendant shall not reside in the areas mentioned in the Indictment,  if deemed necessary by the probation office, defendant shall undergo medical or psychiatric treatment, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 03:00.Hearing held at 05:26.Hearing ended at 05:39. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (ft) (Entered: 11/14/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Juan Ovies, for deft., Anita Hill and PO Emanuel Bravo. Arraignment/Detention as to Justo L. Burgos-Figueroa (6) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 11/8/2012. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The government requested detention. The Court imposed bail in the amount of $5,000 of which $2,500 will be cash or secured and $2,500 unsecured, education subject to verification by the pretrial officer, employment, non electronic curfew from 6:00 pm to 6:00 am, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 09:15.Hearing held at 10:16.Hearing ended at 10:34.Interpreter Ani Navarro. (ft) (Entered: 11/16/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jonathan Rivera-Leon (30) was held on 5/14/2013. The deft was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue an R&R to Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon so that the guilty plea as to Count | of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon. Defendant to remain detained pending sentencing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Motion Hearing as to Jose De la Rosa-Rodriguez (7) held on 6/26/2013 re 489 MOTION to Withdraw as Attorney by Thomas R. Lincoln. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Thomas Lincoln. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Defense counsel informs that last night he spoke to defendant's wife and understood he would be pleading guilty. However, today the defendant informed he would plead guilty to a Type C Plea Agreement. Court addressed the defendant and placed him on notice that a Type  C Plea Agreement will not be accepted. Finding there's no valid reason to grant the request, the Motion to Withdraw as Counsel is DENIED. Trial date remains as set for 7/8/2013 at 9:00 a.m. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 11:00 a.m. Hearing held at 11:35 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:53 a.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (sr) (Entered: 06/26/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Motion Hearing as to Miguel A. Rivera-Mercado (8) held on 6/26/2013 re 488 MOTION to Withdraw as Attorney by Laura Maldonado Rodriguez. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Laura Maldonado. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Defendant does not accept the plea offer and understands that counsel can get a lower one. Government explains that the plea offer extended considered the defendant's role and participation in the conspiracy. Defense counsel informed to the Court the times she visited and met with defendant and discussed the last plea offer extended by the Government. Finding that counsel has provided effective assistance of counsel, the Court Denies the Motion to withdraw. Counsel remains as attorney of record and trial date remains as set. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 11:00 a.m. Hearing held at 11:05 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:32 a.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (sr) (Entered: 06/26/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Further Detention as to Edwin Morales-Marrero (20) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 8/1/2013. Present: SAUSA Vanessa Bonano and defense Marie Cortes. Defendant present O/B and assisted by the court interpreter. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts charged. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon for trial setting. As to bail, Government moved for detention. Defense counsel argued to remain under same conditions of release. After hearing the parties, the Court adopts the conditions of release imposed in the Northern District of Illinois and includes Mental Health and Substance counseling or treatment if deemed appropriate by USPO. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Status Conference as to Edwin Morales-Marrero, Ariel Soto-Nogueras held on 9/16/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata and attorney Marie Cortes (also substituting for attorney Luz Rios). Government informs that full discovery was provided. Arrangements will be made this week to meet with attorney Cortes to provide proffer of testimony to be presented at trial, discuss defendant's criminal record and extend a plea offer. Attorney Cortes clarifies she needs to gather information as to defendant's prior criminal record and participation within the conspiracy and requests twelve (12) days to gather said information and meet with Government's counsel. As to co-defendant Ariel Soto (23), a motion for change of plea will be filed by 9/20/13. Attorney Cortes is granted until 10/4/2013 to meet with Government, verify defendant's prior record, conclude discovery and analyze plea offer. The motion for change of plea of Ariel Soto (23) is to be filed on or before 9/20/13. A Final Status Conference is set for 10/4/2013 at 10:00 AM in  Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. If motion for change of plea is filed, the s/c will be vacated. STA is tolled given the complexity of the case, number of defendants and the lengthy discovery provided. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:25 a.m. Hearing ended at 10:35 a.m. (sr) (Entered: 09/16/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 10/29/2013 for Francisco Martinez-Suro (19). Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Jose Romo. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Shanira Cruz also present. Court notes it met with the USPO and after discussing the case, taking into consideration defendant's particular and personal circumstances, the Court makes an assessment that the criminal history is overrepresented and the adjudication of career offender is not applicable. Based on the Court's ruling, defense counsel states he will not pursue his motion to withdraw plea of guilty. Therefore, motion filed at DE 709 is Denied, Motion filed at DE 803 is Noted and Denied (based on Court's decision) and motion at DE 802 is Granted. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Edwin Alers-De Jesus (25) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 4/9/2015. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Ramon Garay were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel had no evidence to rebut, but reserved the right to reopen the matter of bail if additional information arises. Reservation was noted by the Court. Since this is a presumption case, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:49. Hearing ended at 09:52. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (br) (Entered: 04/14/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Further Status Conference as to Edwin Alers-De Jesus (25) held on 8/5/2015. Present: AUSA Hector Ramirez and defense counsel Ramon Garay. Parties inform that plea offer was tendered, however, the defendant's criminal history category needs to be clarified in order to continue with plea negotiations. Request a final s/c be set in 30 days. Defense anticipates defendant will enter a plea of guilty. Request Granted. Final Status Conference set for 9/10/2015 at 10:00 AM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. The STA is tolled in the best interest of justice, in order to afford parties to conclude plea negotiations. Case will not go to trial. However, if there's no definite response by 9/10/2015, then a prompt notice of trial setting will be given to the parties. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 2:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:20 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:35 p.m. (sr) (Entered: 08/10/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Status Conference as to Edwin Alers-De Jesus (25) held on 9/10/2015. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Ramon Garay. Defense counsel informs he met with Government's counsel and received a proffer as to his client's participation in the conspiracy and also engaged in plea negotiations. Therefore, considering his client's criminal history, he will submit a counteroffer to the Government. Government requests a plea cut-off date for filing the motion for change of plea. Court orders that within the next five (5) days, attorney Garay is to submit his counteroffer to the Government. The plea deadline is due by 9/25/2015. After said date, the Government can refuse to allocate the third point for acceptance of responsibility. Once filed, the motion for change of plea is to be referred to Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll for setting of a Rule 11 Hearing and Report and Recommendation. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:45 a.m. Hearing ended at 10:55 a.m. (sr) (Entered: 09/21/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno- Coll:Change of Plea Hearing as to Edwin Alers-De Jesus held on 12/5/2016. Present were AUSA Amanda Soto and defense counsel Ramon Garay. Defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant was found competent to plea. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Aida M. Delgado Colon, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one (1) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing will be set by the presiding judge. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 9:30 am. Hearing held at 10:27 am. Hearing ended at 10:49 am. Interpreter Heidi Cazes. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 1438 Motion Notifying SRT Violations as to Antonio Borrero-Vargas (13) held on 1/31/2020. Present: AUSA Desiree Laborde, defense counsel Ismael Rodriguez and USPO Camille Machado. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Attorney Rodriguez stated that the defendant admitted to all the violations except the new criminal conduct alleged in the USPO's motion. AUSA Laborde explained that the Government would proceed by proffer and would call USPO Machado to the stand. She informed that the three (3) victims in this case were present and available to testify if necessary. The Court recessed twice. The case was recalled at 11:38 AM and 12:02 PM. A sidebar conference was held with the attorneys. Based on what was discussed at sidebar, the defense decided to waive the hearing. The defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to Rules 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon for Final Revocation Hearing. Attorney Rodriguez requested that the final hearing be set for after 2/18/2020, which is the date of the defendant's trial in state court. The Court recommended that defense counsel file a motion directing his request to the Presiding Judge. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:03.Hearing ended at 12:05.Interpreter Jose Irizarry. (lod) (Entered: 02/03/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Antonio Borrero-Vargas (13) held on 6/29/2020 by VTC. Present: AUSA Desiree Laborde and defense counsel Ismael  Rodriguez. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Camille Machado also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to sentencing, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Defendant did not contest the violations. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Zuleika Rodriguez, present at USPO's Office, assisted by the Court Interpreter Sonia Crescioni was also present by VTC, addressed the Court and made her victim impact statement. Defense counsel also posed questions to the victim. After hearing the parties, the SRT revoked and an imprisonment term of 24 months was imposed. SRT of 4 years was imposed as well. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 1:30 p.m.Hearing held at 1:30 p.m.Hearing ended at 2:25 p.m.Interpreter Sylvia Zetterstrand/Sonia Crescioni. (sr) (Entered: 06/29/2020)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Antonio Borrero- Vargas (13). IMPR 24 months and SRT of 4 years. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 6/29/2020.(sr) (Entered: 06/29/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos A. Cruz-Centeno (26) held on 4/16/2021. AUSA Alexander Alum and AFPD Jesus Hernandez were present. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations filed at ECF No. 1534 and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The FPD was appointed to represent the defendant. Defendant was ordered temporarily detained. A preliminary revocation hearing was set for 4/23/2021 at 02:30 pm via VTC before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant|s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the exclusion of evidence, dismissal of the revocation proceedings regarding the alleged supervised release violations, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. (Court Reporter Zoom Recording.) Hearing set for 04:30. Hearing held at 04:37. Hearing ended at 04:46. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. (jjr) (Entered: 04/19/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Carlos A. Cruz-Centeno (26) held on 6/21/2021. AUSA Jose Ruiz, AFPD Samuel Carrion and USPO J. Semidey were present. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily waived his right to be physically present at the courthouse and consented to proceed via VTC. Furthermore, defendant verbally waived his right to the preliminary revocation hearing. The Court accepted the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to the violations contained in the motion filed at ECF No. 1534 . The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Aida Delgado-Colon for the scheduling of a final revocation hearing. Defense counsel argued for conditions of release. The government argued for detention. Statements from USPO J. Semidey were heard. The Court ordered the defendant detained pending the final revocation hearing. A notice to Guaynabo MDC regarding defendant's medical condition shall be issued. (Court Reporter Zoom.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:22. Hearing ended at 09:46.
